properties.areaDesc: Las Vegas Valley; Spring Mountains-Red Rock Canyon; Lake Mead National Recreation Area; Western Clark and Southern Nye County; Southern Clark County; Northeast Clark County; Sheep Range
properties.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 1 at 11:37PM PST until February 3 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Las Vegas NV
properties.description:
* WHAT...Southwest to west winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts over 60
mph possible late Sunday afternoon and through the overnight
hours. Winds will shift to the northwest by early Monday morning
but stay elevated with gusts over 50 mph possible.

* WHERE...All of Clark County and Southern Nye County. This
includes Las Vegas, Pahrump, Mount Charleston, Red Rock Canyon,
Mesquite, Moapa, Henderson, Boulder City, Laughlin, Primm,
Searchlight, and Desert Rock.

* WHEN...From 4 PM PST Sunday to 6 PM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Very dangerous driving conditions for travelers along
Interstate 15, Highway 95, and the western 215 beltway. High
profile vehicles are especially vulnerable to being blown over
due to extreme winds impacting these highway and other area
roadways. Additionally, damaging wind gusts could result in
multiple and possibly long duration power outages area- wide.
Downed trees and power poles are possible area- wide as well.
Securing any loose items such as trash cans, outdoor plants,
sports equipment, or trampolines, is highly recommended. Areas
of blowing dust are also possible.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest speeds are expected late
Sunday evening and overnight Sunday night as the cold front
passes. Speeds will decrease slightly early Monday morning but
widespread gusts over 40 mph will continue Monday.
properties.instruction:
People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around
trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of
your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use extreme
caution if you must drive, especially if you are operating a
semi-truck or panel truck with a wide trailer.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM SUNDAY TO 6 PM PST MONDAY
